page.title: 13TEYNHAM CARNIVAL
page.content: Teynham is the smallest village in Kent to hold a proper carnival. This year it was held on Saturday 13th July at 7 p.m. It started in Frognal Lane, came along Station Road, went along the London Road and back down Frognal Lane. These roads were closed to traffic. I don't think the crowd was as big as last year. Alan Kemp from our school was dressed as a chimney sweep and he won a prize. I liked the marching bands and the majorettes. There were carnival queens from other towns. Teynham Community Playgroup were on a float and there was a yellow submarine from British Telecom. My favourite float was one with Romans on, from the Fox Inn. Some of the Guides were dressed as circus people on a float. The money collected goes to local charities. After the procession there was a dance.
